Entities.Name: Label
Entities.Definition: Specimen accession numbers used for identification in pathology reports.
Entities.Sample Data: Labels include numbers like ABD-12218, where each label identifies a unique specimen.

Entities.Name: Received Location
Entities.Definition: The original accessioning facility or location where the specimen was collected.
Entities.Sample Data: Locations such as 'Imaginary Hospital (Sample City, IL)' are included in the reports.

Entities.Name: Received Date
Entities.Definition: The date the specimen was received, which is crucial for timeline analysis in clinical settings.
Entities.Sample Data: Dates like 01/02/2014 are annotated to establish a timeline of specimen processing.

Entities.Name: Sublabels
Entities.Definition: Tissue block identifiers that further specify parts of the specimen.
Entities.Sample Data: Sublabels such as 1A-G1, 1AG2, 2AG1 help identify specific sections of the tissue samples.

Dataset.Name: University of Chicago GI Oncology Tumor Bank
Dataset.Details: The dataset includes pathology reports from 2006 to 2016 for patients with gastroesophageal cancer, used to train and validate the NLP pipeline.

Annotation Guidelines.Details: The document details an NLP pipeline that includes a machine learning classification step and a named-entity recognition step, used for extracting specimen information from pathology reports.
